unnormalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Surge in OTT Partnerships to Boost User Engagement**
normalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Surge in O T T Partnerships to Boost User Engagement**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Indian telecommunications providers are aggressively forging partnerships with Over-The-Top (OTT) platforms to enhance subscriber value and combat churn, industry analysts report. The trend, reminiscent of the bundled data and calling plans of the "3 Idiots" era, aims to offer a comprehensive entertainment and connectivity package.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Indian telecommunications providers are aggressively forging partnerships with Over-The-Top (O T T) platforms to enhance subscriber value and combat churn, industry analysts report. The trend, reminiscent of the bundled data and calling plans of the "three Idiots" era, aims to offer a comprehensive entertainment and connectivity package.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio recently announced a strategic alliance with Disney+ Hotstar, offering bundled subscriptions to its prepaid users. Airtel is reportedly in talks with Amazon Prime Video and Zee5 to create similar integrated offerings. These partnerships are expected to drive data consumption and boost Average Revenue Per User (ARPU).

unnormalised: "Indian consumers are increasingly seeking value-added services. Bundling OTT subscriptions with telecom plans offers a compelling proposition, particularly in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities," says Mr. Sharma, a telecommunications analyst at IIT Delhi. Industry experts predict further consolidation in the space, with smaller telecom players likely to seek similar partnerships to remain competitive. The partnerships will also leverage content in regional languages like Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.
